# awscc_ec2_vpc_encryption_control (Data Source)

Data Source schema for AWS::EC2::VPCEncryptionControl



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `id` (String) Uniquely identifies the resource.

### Read-Only

- `egress_only_internet_gateway_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable EIGW exclusion
- `elastic_file_system_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable EFS exclusion
- `internet_gateway_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable IGW exclusion
- `lambda_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable Lambda exclusion
- `mode` (String) The VPC encryption control mode, either monitor or enforce.
- `nat_gateway_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable Nat gateway exclusion
- `resource_exclusions` (Attributes) Enumerates the states of all the VPC encryption control resource exclusions (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--resource_exclusions))
- `state` (String) The current state of the VPC encryption control.
- `state_message` (String) Provides additional context on the state of the VPC encryption control.
- `tags` (Attributes List) The tags to assign to the VPC encryption control. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--tags))
- `virtual_private_gateway_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable VGW exclusion
- `vpc_encryption_control_id` (String) The VPC encryption control resource id.
- `vpc_id` (String) The VPC on which this VPC encryption control is applied.
- `vpc_lattice_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable Vpc Lattice exclusion
- `vpc_peering_exclusion_input` (String) Used to enable or disable VPC peering exclusion

### Nested Schema for `tags`

Read-Only:

- `key` (String) The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
- `value` (String) The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
